item.title: The Approximate Mind, Part 25: The Plural Self
item.description:
You are not one person.

You are Margaret-the-grandmother when your daughter visits with the children. Different values, different priorities, different ways of speaking. The self that emerges in that context genuinely differs from other Margarets.

item.title: The Approximate Mind, Part 35: The Compounding Self
item.description:
Six months have passed since Margaret first used the new system.

She does not notice the changes consciously. They accumulate like sediment. Small adjustments that compound into something that feels different from the AI assistants she tried before.

item.title: The Approximate Mind, Part 39: The Neurodivergent Partner
item.description:
The average child does not exist.

This should be obvious. Yet nearly every intervention assumes a statistical norm. Children are measured against averages. Progress is defined as movement toward typical.
